results.title: Superstars in concert
results.creator_credit: Peter Clifton, John Heyman and World Film Services
results.brief_description: Filmed on location in Europe from 1964-1973 this historical documentary features some of the British and American rock music superstars of the 60s and early 70s at venues such as Hyde Park, the Isle of Wight, and various concert halls across Europe. It includes some amazing archival footage and behind-the-scenes action reflecting the culture and mood of the generation of the time and features performances by the Rolling Stones, Eric Burdon and the Animals, Crazy World of Arthur Brown, Otis Redding, Cream, Blind Faith, Cat Stephens, Jimi Hendrix, Donovan, Joe Cocker, Ike and Tina turner, Pink Floyd, Rod Stewart. A baby-boomer’s nostalgia trip.

results.title: Superfluid helium
results.creator_credit: Jack F. Allen and University of St Andrews
results.brief_description: Discusses the various dramatic properties of superfluid helium. Also explains why these properties occur as well as why the term superfluid is used.

results.title: Superglue and angel wings

results.title: Superman. -Volume 1
results.brief_description: This tape features 5 technicolour classics originally screened from 1941 to 1943, with a VHS transfer from the original 35mm print. Individual episodes include: “Superman”; Superman makes his first appearance saving Metropolis from a mad scientist and his dangerous electrothenasia ray; “The Mechanical monsters”; Superman must once again save the day and protect Metropolis from thieving robots; “Billion dollar limited”; a train laden with gold is in danger from being stolen; “Arctic giant”; dinosaurs walk the earth when a frozen dinosaur from Siberia thaws out; “Bulleteers”; crooks in a bullet shaped rocket car threaten destruction to Metropolis unless their demands are met. Also included on this tape is the spoof “Snafuperman”. This wartime parody is about Private Snafu, entrusted with super powers by a technical fairy, who uses his abilities to fight the Nazis.

results.title: Super sense. Part 2
results.brief_description: Imagine being able to experience the world through animal senses, to go on a unique journey into the heart of the animal kingdom. Using recently pioneered breakthroughs in filming and special effects photography, that journey is now made possible. This cassette contains three episodes: “Super scents”: Smell - it is the territorial signal of gazelles, the alarm system of impalas, the aphrodisiac of moths and salamandas. Stil more astounding, it is the sense that guides the salmon back to its birthplace where it travels to spawn and die. “Sense of timing”: A shrew lives its life thiry times faster than an elephant, the body clocks of marine animals measure tidal cycles… this innovative program reveals, as if by magic, the different time worlds in which creatures live. “Making sense”: Draws together the threads of the series and shows how the mind influences an animal’s view of the world.

results.title: Superfly
results.creator_credit: Gordon Parks Jr, Sig Shore and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: In the early seventies, mirroring the influential defiant culture of the Black Panthers there developed a uniquely “black” cinema in the United States. Featuring gritty street-wise characters, funk music and liberal doses of sex and violence, this genre quickly developed the name “blaxploitation” - a cinema directed to, and for, largely urban Afro-American audiences. Gordon Parks Jr’s “Superfly” is one of the most important films of the genre, as it unapologetically refused to compromise to white audience expectations. The hero, Priest, is a tough pimp and drug trafficker, who snorts cocaine throughout the movie and has little time for white people and their rules. The film follows his misadventures as he attempts to go straight in a world where the straights don’t want him. With limited resources, Parks Jr manages to create a highly entertaining and fast-paced thriller, fuelled by a brutal lead performance by Ron O’Neal and a stunning score by soul and funk musician, Curtis Mayfield.

results.title: Superfluous people
results.brief_description: A grim and unremitting survey of New York citizens exiled at the margins of capitalist society including the elderly displaced by new housing construction; a woman on relief whose husband was recently released from a mental institution; and those who live in the slums of New York. A document of its time, the film describes the challenge confronting the progressive social aspirations of the Kennedy era. Tough, touching and uncompromising, this is a fascinating documentary with some acute insights into contemporary civilisation.

results.title: Sunrise: a song of two humans
results.creator_credit: Friedrich W. Murnau, William Fox and Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The first intertitle declares “This song of the Man and his Wife is of no place and every place; you might hear it anywhere and at anytime”. This is true of the film as it is a timeless tale of love and redemption. Tempted by a femme fatale, the Man, a poor farmer, is seduced by the idea of murdering his wife to run off to the city with the object of his adulterous love. Academy Award winning, classic silent cinema from German director F.W. Murnau, his first American production. Screenplay by Carl Mayer. Digitally restored and remastered with the original and an alternative new soundtrack, as well as other special features on two discs. Cast includes George O’Brien, Janet Gaynor, Margaret Livingston.
